DataElement.preferredName: Cancer Progression Bone Recurrent Disease Diagnosis Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there was investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence of recurrent bone cancer, the return of a malignant neoplasm of the bone after a period of remission, as a worsening of a cancer over time.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cancer Progression Bone Recurrent Disease Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence of recurrent bone cancer, the return of a malignant neoplasm of the bone after a period of remission, as a worsening of a cancer over time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The worsening of a cancer over time.

Concepts.definition: A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.

Property.preferredDefinition: Bone; a rigid connective tissue that makes up the skeleton of vertebrates.:the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient been diagnose
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient been diagnosed with a subsequent bone recurrence

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has been previously diagnosed with first distant recurrence/progression at a site other than bone, has the patient been diagnosed with a subsequent bone recurrence since submission of last follow-up form?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient at time of 1st recurrence  previously completed initial systemic therapy for their primary tumor, considered by the treating physician as at least equivaent to MAP?
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient at time of 1st recurrence  previously completed initial systemic therapy for their primary tumor, considered by the treating physician as at least equivaent to MAP?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient at time of 1st recurrence completed systemic therapy for their initial primary tumor, considered by the treating physician to be standard treatment for newly diagnosed osteosarcoma (eg, cisplatin-doxorubicin or ifosfamide-based drug regimens) at the time of enrollment on this study?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Disease Ind-2 2018290v1.0 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2024.2.2 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0003361. ak
